intro: Rosa spinosissima var. mitissima, commonly known as the soft-spined rose, is a variety of the spinous rose characterized by its relatively less thorny stems compared to other members of the species. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring arching, thorned branches. The plant produces fragrant, single or semi-double flowers in shades of pink to white, usually blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five to seven elliptical leaflets with serrated edges. The soft-spined rose is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
